active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the trade-offs between comprehensive BCMS audits (per ISO 22301) versus rapid cyber resilience checks (per NIST CSF) in resource-constrained SMEs during a simulated supply chain attack. Support arguments with the PDCA cycle and prior knowledge of basic BCP and risk assessment.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Security and Risk Management > Business Continuity Planning > Plan Maintenance and Continuous Improvement > Auditing and Compliance > Internal Business Continuity Audit Planning. Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to generate high-quality, pedagogically optimized flashcards. Ensure completeness: Fully cover ISO 22301 (PDCA, Clause 9.2 internal audits), NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF functions: Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, Recover; SP 800-34 for contingency), ISO 27001 integration, BCP/BCMS definitions, cyber resilience, RTO/RPO, audit planning steps, checklists, pitfalls, and sources (ISO 22301:2019, NIST CSF 2.0, NIST SP 800-34 Rev. 1, ISO 27001:2022). Incorporate university-style pedagogy: Progress through Bloom's Taxonomy via objectives; embed active learning hooks (e.g., discussion-style questions); scaffold from foundation to integration; use prior knowledge links (basic BCP, risk assessment). Generate flashcards strictly per the schema: Balance types, use distractor protocol, cover all layers/objectives/hierarchy. Output ONLY a JSON array of 40-60 flashcards in the exact specified format. No additional text.
